content:
LinqDataSourceDesigner Class

Definition

Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the LinqDataSource control.

In this Article

public class LinqDataSourceDesigner : System.Web.UI.Design.DataSourceDesigner

Remarks

In a visual designer, when you switch to a designer view (such as Design view in Visual Studio), the LinqDataSource control markup is parsed. A design-time version of the control is then created on the design surface. When you switch to source view, the design-time control is persisted as the markup for the Web page.

The LinqDataSourceDesigner class provides design-time support for the LinqDataSource control in a visual designer.

Constructors

LinqDataSourceDesigner()

Initializes a new instance of the LinqDataSourceDesigner class.

public LinqDataSourceDesigner ();

Properties

ActionLists

Gets a list of items that are used to create an action list menu at design time.

public override System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection ActionLists { get; }
Value
DesignerActionListCollection

A collection that contains the action list items.

CanConfigure

Gets a value that indicates whether the stem.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.Configure* method can be called by the design host.

public override bool CanConfigure { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the stem.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.Configure* method can be called; otherwise, false.

Remarks

The Configure method can be called if the Site property of the associated LinqDataSource control implements the System.ComponentModel.Design.ITypeDiscoveryService interface. In that case, the CanConfigure property value is true.

If the CanConfigure property is true, the Configure Data Source menu item is displayed in the LinqDataSource Tasks menu of the associated control on the visual designer surface. When this item is selected, the Configure Data Source wizard is started.

CanRefreshSchema

Gets a value that indicates whether the stem.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.RefreshSchema* method can be called by the design host.

public override bool CanRefreshSchema { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the stem.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.RefreshSchema* method can be called; otherwise, false.

Remarks

The RefreshSchema method can be called if all the following conditions are true:

  • The Site property of the associated LinqDataSource control implements the System.ComponentModel.Design.ITypeDiscoveryService interface.

  • The ContextTypeName property contains a value.

    If these conditions are true, the CanRefreshSchema property value is true.

    If the CanRefreshSchema is true, the Refresh Schema menu item is displayed in the LinqDataSource Tasks menu of the associated control on the visual designer surface.

ContextTypeName

Gets or sets the name of the type that contains the property whose value has the data that you want to retrieve.

public string ContextTypeName { get; set; }
Value
String

The name of the class to retrieve data from.

Delete

Gets or sets a value for the delete operation.

public string Delete { get; set; }
Value
String

null.

Remarks

In a LinqDataSource instance, setting this property has no effect. This property shadows a property in the associated control, and is intended for internal use only.

EnableDelete

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether rows can be deleted from the data source at run time.

public bool EnableDelete { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the delete operation is enabled for users of the associated LinqDataSource instance; otherwise, false.

EnableInsert

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether rows can be inserted into the data source at run time.

public bool EnableInsert { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the insert operation is enabled for users of the associated LinqDataSource instance; otherwise, false.

EnableUpdate

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether rows in the data source can be updated at run time.

public bool EnableUpdate { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the update operation is enabled for users of the associated LinqDataSource instance; otherwise, false.

GroupBy

Gets or sets the value that is used when the Group By clause is being created.

public string GroupBy { get; set; }
Value
String

A string that contains the properties that are used for grouping data.

Insert

Gets or sets a value for the delete operation.

public string Insert { get; set; }
Value
String

null.

Remarks

In a LinqDataSource instance, setting this property has no effect. This property shadows a property in the associated control, and is intended for internal use only.

OrderBy

Gets or sets the value that is used when the Order By clause is being created.

public string OrderBy { get; set; }
Value
String

A string that contains the properties that are used for sorting the data.

OrderGroupsBy

Gets or sets the value that is used when the Order Groups By clause is being created.

public string OrderGroupsBy { get; set; }
Value
String

A string that contains the properties that are used for sorting grouped data.

Select

Gets or sets the string that contains values for the select operation.

public string Select { get; set; }
Value
String

A string that is used when the Select clause is being created.

ServiceProvider

Gets the service provider that is associated with the LinqDataSource instance.

public IServiceProvider ServiceProvider { get; }
Value
IServiceProvider

An object that represents the service provider.

TableName

Gets or sets the stem.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource.TableName* property of the LinqDataSource instance.

public string TableName { get; set; }
Value
String

The name of the class that contains the data.

Update

Gets the value for the Update operation.

public string Update { get; set; }
Value
String

null.

Remarks

In a LinqDataSource instance, setting this property has no effect. This property shadows a property in the associated control, and is intended for internal use only.

Where

Gets or sets the stem.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource.Where* property of the LinqDataSource control.

public string Where { get; set; }
Value
String

The value of the stem.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource.Where* property.

Methods

Configure()

Launches the data source configuration wizard in the design host.

public override void Configure ();

Remarks

The Configure method starts the Configure Data Source wizard on the visual designer surface.

The Configure method is called when the Configure Data Source menu item is selected on the LinqDataSource Tasks menu of the associated LinqDataSource control. The Configure Data Source menu item appears on the LinqDataSource Tasks menu when the CanConfigure property is true.

GetView(String)

Returns a data source view that has the specified name.

public override System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerDataSourceView GetView (string viewName);
viewName
String

The name of the view to return.

Returns
DesignerDataSourceView

An object whose name is specified by viewName; otherwise, null.

GetViewNames()

Gets a list of available views.

public override string[] GetViewNames ();
Returns
String[]

A collection with one element that contains the name "DefaultView".

Initialize(IComponent)

Initializes the control designer and loads the specified component.

public override void Initialize (System.ComponentModel.IComponent component);
component
IComponent

The object to initialize.

PreFilterProperties(IDictionary)

Used by the designer to add properties or remove properties in the properties grid.

protected override void PreFilterProperties (System.Collections.IDictionary properties);
properties
IDictionary

The properties to be filtered.

RefreshSchema(Boolean)

Refreshes the schema from the underlying data source.

public override void RefreshSchema (bool preferSilent);
preferSilent
Boolean

true to suppress all data source events until the schema is refreshed.

Remarks

The design host calls the RefreshSchema method only if CanRefreshSchema is true.
